Instrument.name: WIDE FIELD PLANETARY CAMERA 2 for HST
Instrument.description: The Wide Field Planetary Camera 2 (WFPC2) aboard the Hubble Space Telescope was a camera that covered UV, visible, and infrared wavelengths from 120 to 1000 nm. WFPC2â€™s field of view was 2.7 arcminutes square. It was installed in 1993, replacing the Wide Field and Planetary Camera (WF/PC). It was replaced by the Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3) in 2009.
